brief_description: This study will measure the immune response to the influenza vaccine  The long-term goal is to develop improved vaccines to infectious diseases such as influenza. Blood will be collected from patients at several visits before and after vaccination. The blood will be used in a series of immunological tests to measure the strength and breadth of immune response. These assays may include T cell and B cell activation assays, microarray testing, Epimax, Epigen, and flow cytometry.
brief_title: Systems Biology Approach to Analysis of 2010-11 TIV Fluzone Influenza Vaccine Response in Healthy Individuals (see companion studies SDY301, SDY296)
condition_studied: Vaccine responses in healthy adult population.
description: This study will measure the immune response to the influenza vaccine  The long-term goal is to develop improved vaccines to infectious diseases such as influenza. Blood will be collected from patients at several visits before and after vaccination. The blood will be used in a series of immunological tests to measure the strength and breadth of immune response. These assays may include T cell and B cell activation assays, microarray testing, Epimax, Epigen, and flow cytometry.
hypothesis: That immune responses can be measured longitudinally after vaccination and that the information gained may be useful for developing novel vaccines.
objectives: To measure immune responses to vaccination with flu vaccine in healthy adult subjects.
official_title: Systems Biology Approach to Analysis of 2010-11 TIV Fluzone Influenza Vaccine Response in Healthy Individuals (see companion studies SDY301, SDY296)

pubmed.title: Induction of ICOS+CXCR3+CXCR5+ TH cells correlates with antibody responses to influenza vaccination.

program.contract_name: Systems Analysis Vaccine Responses in Healthy and Hyporesponsive Humans
